paper_abstract: We establish that the extension complexity of the correlation polytope is at least by a short proof that is self-contained except for using the fact that every face of a polyhedron is the intersection of all facets it is contained in. The main innovative aspect of the proof is a simple combinatorial argument showing that the rectangle covering number of the unique-disjointness matrix is at least , and thus the nondeterministic communication complexity of the unique-disjointness predicate is at least . We thereby slightly improve on the previously best known lower bounds and , respectively.
paper_title: A Short Proof that the Extension Complexity of the Correlation Polytope Grows Exponentially
